data.text: @gsoh31 Only had real flu twice in my life, took over two weeks to recover enough to function enough to do some work. First week couldn't get out of bed & couldn't be bothered to drink the iced water easily in reach ached far too much to voluntarily move.

@gsoh31 @Mole_9 Absolutely. I've had several bouts of flu over the years. By far the worst was in my early twenties when I was in bed semi concious for over a week and took three months to fully recover. Mind you that was nothing compared to viral bronchitis which was awful.

@gsoh31 A friend of mine - mid 30s, physically fit, working mum of 3 kids - had a serious bout of flu in 2014. Hospitalized, induced coma, almost died, left the hospital 2 months later attached to an oxygen tank, permanent lung damage.
@Mole_9 Yep - I reckon at least three or four bedridden days (or days on which you should be in bed) with flu.

@gsoh31 If someone's "had flu" and are back at work in two days, it wasn't flu. There's some truth in the £50 note test: there's a £50 note between your bed and the door. If you can pick it up, it's yours. If you pick it up, pretty sure you don't have flu.
